first_reading.text:
[[Ga 5,1]]Brothers and sisters: For freedom Christ set us free; so stand firm and do not submit again to the yoke of slavery.
[[Ga 5,2]]It is I, Paul, who am telling you that if you have yourselves circumcised, Christ will be of no benefit to you.
[[Ga 5,3]]Once again I declare to every man who has himself circumcised that he is bound to observe the entire law.
[[Ga 5,4]]You are separated from Christ, you who are trying to be justified by law; you have fallen from grace.
[[Ga 5,5]]For through the Spirit, by faith, we await the hope of righteousness.
[[Ga 5,6]]For in Christ Jesus, neither circumcision nor uncircumcision counts for anything, but only faith working through love.
first_reading.title: Letter to the Galatians

gospel.text:
[[Lc 11,37]]After Jesus had spoken, a Pharisee invited him to dine at his home. He entered and reclined at table to eat.
[[Lc 11,38]]The Pharisee was amazed to see that he did not observe the prescribed washing before the meal.
[[Lc 11,39]]The Lord said to him, "Oh you Pharisees! Although you cleanse the outside of the cup and the dish, inside you are filled with plunder and evil.
[[Lc 11,40]]You fools! Did not the maker of the outside also make the inside?
[[Lc 11,41]]But as to what is within, give alms, and behold, everything will be clean for you."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke

psalm.text:
[[Ps 119,41]]Let your mercy come to me, O LORD, 
your salvation according to your promise.
[[Ps 119,43]]Take not the word of truth from my mouth, 
for in your ordinances is my hope.

[[Ps 119,44]]I will keep your law continually, 
forever and ever.
[[Ps 119,45]]I will walk at liberty, 
because I seek your precepts.

[[Ps 119,47]]I will delight in your commands, 
which I love.
[[Ps 119,48]]I will lift up my hands to your commands 
and meditate on your statutes.
psalm.title: Psalms
